result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin James Vanegeren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - bond and attorney fees previously posted have been applied.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with A. Dunsirn directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:46 p.m. Defendant Kevin James Vanegeren in court with attorney Max Wayne Saylor.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: 5 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, NC w/ A. Dunsirn, Atty fees w/ 60 DTP or PP, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Max Wayne Saylor in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Saylor requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

02:48 pm case called. Defendant Kevin James Vanegeren in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant requests counsel be appointed. Court will appoint an attorney upon posting of $250.00 by 3/27/15. Payments of $50.00 per month commencing May 1, 2015 and by the 1st of each month until further order of the court.  NGP entered.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State-probable cause found. Court continues bond as previously ordered.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:20 pm.
Original Executed Bond Form Returned from WCJ

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing or ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant to take any and all medication ordered by by treating physician.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Kevin James Vanegeren in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released and remains employed. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting lower cash bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
